title: Acoustic Theory of Speech Production
significance: This paper laid the foundation for how we understand speech production today. The source-filter model is still used in every voice synthesis system!

title: The Motor Theory of Speech Perception
significance: Proposed that speech perception involves motor simulation - we understand speech by mentally simulating how we would produce those sounds. Hugely influential!

title: A Tutorial on Hidden Markov Models
significance: Provided the statistical framework that revolutionized speech recognition. HMMs enabled the first practical large-vocabulary systems.

title: Distinctive Features and Phonological Opposition
significance: Established distinctive features as the building blocks of phonology. Influenced decades of linguistic theory and speech recognition systems.

title: Articulatory Phonology
significance: Introduced articulatory phonology as a dynamic approach. Rather than static positions speech involves coordinated gestural patterns - a paradigm shift!

title: Speech Perception by the Human Brain
significance: Integrated neuroscience with speech perception proposing dual processing streams in the brain. Changed how we think about neural basis of speech.

title: Coarticulation in Connected Speech
significance: Systematically described how speech sounds overlap in natural speech. Essential for understanding fluent speech production vs isolated sounds.

title: A Mathematical Theory of Communication
significance: While not speech-specific Shannon's information theory provided the mathematical foundation for all digital communication including speech transmission.

title: Categorical Perception of Speech Sounds
significance: Introduced categorical perception - the idea that we perceive continuous acoustic signals as discrete phonetic categories. Revolutionized speech perception research.

title: Deep Neural Networks for Acoustic Modeling
significance: Showed that deep learning could dramatically improve speech recognition accuracy. Sparked the neural network revolution in speech technology.
